Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: is it possible to dynamically increase payment size and number of payments in a channel as needed? Or is it necessary to open a new channel with allocation once a channel is exhausted?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You’ll need to open new channel with different capacity and denomination if needed

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If I’ve understood correct that’s your question is related to channelsCC 🙂

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: yes exactly,  thanks for the answer

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: I've opened a payments channel and it has 61 confirmations but i still get this return when trying to send a payment:

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content:
"result": "error",
"error": "channelsopen tx not yet confirmed/notarized"

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: any ideas?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: confirmations but no notarizations?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels without notarization needs 100 blocks, unless you built with TESTMODE

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 61 confs should mean notarized if dpowconfs are in use, unless you are quoting raw confs from an explorer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @redp1ll the most costly part of starting and running Smart Chains is having the knowledge or paying people with the knowledge. We are not like other projects that try to tax you in every way for using our stuff, gas costs and chain creation fees and all kinds of scammy stuff

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: @dukeleto  I've got no notarization activated so need to mine 100 blocks then. Is the fastest way to generate blocks to just send txs to myself as it's an on demand blockchain?

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: @dukeleto I think it's an awesome and very refreshing approach that you guys have. One of the things that sets this ecosystem apart from the competition and I'm sure it will pay off in the future

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @redp1ll yes, the normal way is to always have 2 nodes, one seed node and another peer that is mining. You are using a new feature that allows doing it one one node. You should use `setgenerate` to turn mining on

Author: Sentrail#6141
Content: well, im definitely doing something wrong because console didnt found the command

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `./komodo-cli -ac_name=STRIKETWODEMO getpeerinfo`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Sentrail try that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the initial `./` is important

Author: Sentrail#6141

Author: Sentrail#6141
Content: :c

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
```
cd ~/komodo/src
./komodo-cli -ac_name=STRIKETWODEMO getpeerinfo
```

Your screenshot earlier shows you are in `~/komodo` directory, however the executable `komodo-cli` is in the `~/komodo/src` dir

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: `getinfo` will also show the number of connections.  Likely to be 1 when both your seed and 2nd node are connected to each other

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
I'm not sure if there is anyone that wrote a guide or not, but the `help` function is a good place to start
`komodo-cli -ac_name=SOMENAME help`
will give you a list of all of the features/functions and
`komodo-cli -ac_name=SOMENAME help some_function_name_here`
will give you specific details and examples for that thing
